articles.title: Vaccine Hesitancy Hurts Covid Fight in Poorer Countries - The New York Times
articles.description: Vaccines are finally available in many African countries, but an underfunded public health system has slowed their delivery, and some people there, as well as in South Asia, are wary of taking them.
articles.content: Though Black South Africans express greater openness to inoculation, they are vaccinated at lower rates, often citing difficulty getting to vaccination sites. Some also express hesitation about getti… [+2642 chars]
